Class GrundyRecGplusGequalsP

java.lang.Object
GrundyRecGplusGequalsP
class GrundyRecGplusGequalsP extends Object
Grundy game with AI for the machine This is the 4th version and brings together the optimisations of the previous versions (1.1, 1.2, 1.3) and the simplification of winning piles of the same type.

    • estConnuePerdante

      boolean estConnuePerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      This method returns true if and only if AFTER normalization of the game, there is a tie between the game and a situation known as in the table of losing situations.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the situation is known to be a loser, false otherwise.

    • estConnueGagnante

      boolean estConnueGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      This method returns true if and only if AFTER normalizing the game, there is a tie between the game and a situation known as winner in the table of winning situations posWinner.
      Parameters:
      jeu - normalized game configuration
      Returns:
      true if this configuration is known false otherwise

    • estPerdante

      boolean estPerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      RECURSIVE method which indicates whether the configuration (of the current game or trial game) is losing. This method is used by the machine to determine whether the opponent can lose (at 100%).
      Parameters:
      jeu - current game board (the state of the game at a certain point during the game)
      Returns:
      true if the (game) configuration is losing, false otherwise

    • estGagnante

      boolean estGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates whether the configuration is a winner. Method that simply calls isLosing.
      Parameters:
      jeu - board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is winning, false otherwise

    • enlever

      void enlever(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, int nb)
      Divide the matches in a line into two piles (1 line = 1 pile). The new pile is placed at the end of the board. The pile that is divided decreases by the number of matches removed.
      Parameters:
      jeu - array of matches per line
      ligne - heap for which matches must be separated
      nb - number of matches REMOVED from the heap (line) on separation

    • estPossible

      boolean estPossible(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Tests whether it is possible to separate one of the heaps
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one heap of 3 matches or more, false otherwise

    • premier

      int premier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai)
      Create an initial test configuration from the game
      Parameters:
      jeu - board
      jeuEssai - new game configuration
      Returns:
      the number of the heap divided in two or (-1) if there is no heap of at least 3 matches

    • testPremier

      void testPremier()
      Brief tests of the premier() method

    • testCasPremier

      void testCasPremier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> res)
      Test a case of the testPremier method
      Parameters:
      jeu - the game board
      ligne - the number of the heap split first
      res - the game board after a first split

    • suivant

      int suivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne)
      Generates the following test configuration (i.e. ONE possible decomposition)
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - trial configuration of the game after separation
      ligne - the number of the heap which was the last to be split
      Returns:
      the number of the heap divided in two for the new configuration, -1 if no further decomposition is possible

    • testSuivant

      void testSuivant()
      Brief tests of the suivant() method

    • testCasSuivant

      void testCasSuivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne, ArrayList<Integer> resJeu, int resLigne)
      Test a case of the following method
      Parameters:
      jeu - the game board
      jeuEssai - the game board obtained after separating a heap
      ligne - is the number of the heap that was last split
      resJeu - is the TestGame expected after splitting
      resLigne - is the expected number of the heap that is split
